p: Influenza is an infectious viral illness that occurs in seasonal epidemics every year [ 1]. It is mainly caused by influenza type A virus (A/H1N1 and A/H3N2 subtypes) and type B (B/Victoria and B/Yamagata lineages), or any combination of these. Influenza B is more stable than influenza A, with less antigenic drift and consequent immunological stability, although genetic distance of influenza B lineages has been increasing over the years [ 2].
